data.title: Can Thailand be better than this? - Parit Wacharasindhu | Time to Talk EP.22
data.description:
Can Thailand Be Better Than This? 
Join us on Time to Talk as we sit down with Itim Parit Wacharasindhu, List MP from the opposition People’s Party.

data.title: Legal expert says Yingluck can’t avoid prosecution
data.description: Former prime minister  Yingluck Shinawatra , who fled the country seven years ago, can return home whenever she wants as long as she is willing to face legal  prosecution , former deputy prime minister Wissanu Krea-ngam said on Tuesday.

data.title: Legal expert says Yingluck can’t avoid prosecution
data.description: Former prime minister  Yingluck Shinawatra , who fled the country seven years ago, can return home whenever she wants as long as she is willing to face legal  prosecution , former deputy prime minister Wissanu Krea-ngam said on Tuesday.

data.title: Dozens of complaints against Pheu Thai dismissed
data.description: The  Election Commission  (EC) says it has dismissed almost 50 complaints filed against the Pheu Thai  Party seeking its disbandment, leaving only six cases under investigation.

data.title: 20 Years On: Thailand Advances Disaster Resilience
data.description: General His Serene Highness Prince Chalermsuk Yugala Graces “Remembering the 20th Year of the 2004 Indian Ocean Earthquake and Tsunami in Thailand, Reflections for Advancing Disaster Management through Higher Education-Industry Partnerships” Forum at AIT

data.title: Thai airlines expand routes to capitalise on booming Indian tourism
data.description: Indian tourist arrivals expected to surpass pre-pandemic levels this year

data.title: Zoo assures fans Moo Deng did not eat tissue paper
data.description: Khao Kheow Open Zoo has assured Moo Deng’s fans that a tourist did not drop the piece of tissue paper she was seen chewing on in her enclosure - a monkey did it.

data.title: Pheu Thai offers to withdraw bill to reduce military’s power
data.description: Prayut Siripanich cites opposition from society and coalition parties

data.title: Malaysian ex-PM Mahathir denies ‘betrayal’ allegations
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR - Former Malaysian prime minister Mahathir Mohamad has denied allegations that he betrayed the country, after a royal inquiry called for a criminal investigation against him over a 2018 government decision to drop claims to two disputed islets.

data.title: Parliament hosts 2024 Constitution Day Celebration
data.description: Event features various activities at Parliament building throughout Monday and Tuesday

data.title: Israel seizes buffer zone inside Syria
data.description: DAMASCUS - An Israeli military incursion into Syria has reached about 25 kilometres southwest of Damascus, Syrian security sources said on Tuesday, after Israel seized a buffer zone in the south of the country and launched air strikes on Syrian army and air bases overnight.

data.title: Once Wongamat: Pattaya's Tallest Sustainable Luxury Haven
data.description: Honour Group, a leading real estate developer headquartered in Pattaya, has officially launched “Once Wongamat,” a landmark luxury condominium project in North Pattaya under the concept “Reserve the Rarest, Deserve the Finest.” The project blends world-class elegance with sustainability, aiming to redefine premium residences and investment opportunities in Thailand’s premier coastal destination, with a target to sell all 548 units by early 2029.

data.title: Singer, national artist Santi Lunpae dies, aged 88
data.description: Sub-Lt Santi Lunpae, a national artist in the field of performing arts, died of old age early Tuesday at King Chulalongkorn Memorial Hospital, Bangkok. He was 88.

data.title: Thai authorities ramp up efforts against illegal imports, businesses
data.description: Measures like stricter VAT collection, enhanced product testing and regulatory reforms have already reduced illegal imports by 27%

data.title: Thailand mourns the loss of vocal icon Santi Loonpe
data.description: The national artist, who was known for his legendary renditions of King Rama IX’s compositions and patriotic songs, dies at age 88

data.title: True Corp says it seeks fairness in NBTC’s DTAC merger approval
data.description: Company argues that the NBTC's post-merger requirements for True are overly stringent

data.title: FTI review analyses Prime Minister Paetongtarn's governance
data.description: Business federation highlights both achievements and critical areas requiring attention

data.title: Land Bank to continue supporting farmers, govt says
data.description: High-level meeting signals government's ongoing dedication to resolving land-related challenges for rural communities

data.title: Malaysian lawmakers approve broader internet controls
data.description: Malaysian lawmakers have voted in favour of broadening the government’s control over the internet, unmoved by criticism that the law risks suppressing dissent and free speech.

data.title: More parties oppose Pheu Thai Party’s anti-coup bill
data.description: The coalition-member  United Thai Nation  Party (UTN) and the opposition  Palang Pracharat  Party (PPRP) have expressed their objection to a  bill  drafted by an MP of the ruling  Pheu Thai  Party intended to prevent future  military coups .

data.title: Autopsy finds blood infection, swollen spine in singer's death
data.description: An autopsy has found that the death of the Udon Thani-native singer, who died after having a series of "neck-cracking" massages, was due to a blood infection and a swollen spinal cord.
